caption: Anomaly
description: Represents an anomaly or deviation detected in the system that requires investigation or remediation
name: anomaly

attribute.description: The specific attribute or property within the dimension where the anomaly was observed (e.g. CPU usage, response time, error rate)

observation_type.description: The type of behavioral analysis being performed. Examples include: 'Frequency Analysis' (analyzing how often something occurs), 'Time Pattern Analysis' (analyzing when activities occur), 'Volume Analysis' (analyzing quantity/size of activities), 'Sequence Analysis' (analyzing order of events), 'Association Analysis' (analyzing relationships between activities), 'Distribution Analysis' (analyzing statistical distributions), 'Velocity Analysis' (analyzing rate of changes), 'Behavioral Clustering' (analyzing groups of similar behaviors), 'Deviation Analysis' (analyzing deviations from norm). etc

observations.description: Details about the observed anomaly or observations that were flagged as anomalous compared to expected baseline behavior.

observed_pattern.description: The specific pattern identified within the observation type. For Frequency Analysis, this could be 'FREQUENT', 'INFREQUENT', 'RARE', or 'UNSEEN'. For Time Pattern Analysis, this could be 'BUSINESS_HOURS', 'OFF_HOURS', or 'UNUSUAL_TIME'. For Volume Analysis, this could be 'NORMAL_VOLUME', 'HIGH_VOLUME', or 'SURGE'. The pattern values are specific to each observation type and indicate how the observed behavior relates to the baseline.
